formName: C118 section 6 part 3 apply for Authorised Economic Operator

fields.label: Your trader identification number is the same as your Economic Operator Registration and Identification (EORI) number
Member states country codes
fields.infoText:
Find the required [member state country codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-country-and-currency-codes/uk-trade-tariff-country-and-currency-codes#a "Member state country codes") here 

 You will need to press back in your browser to get back to this form

fields.label: EORI number
fields.helpText: Enter your country code follow by your 12 numerical digit EORI number, for example GB123456789123

sections.title: 6.4.1: Cargo units (as containers, swap bodies, transport boxes)
sections.description: Guidance for this section can be found at (AEO Guidelines Part 2 Section V, Subsection 4)

fields.label: Is access to cargo units subject to rules/restrictions?
fields.shortName: Access to cargo units subject to rules/restrictions

sections.title: Cargo units (as containers, swap bodies, transport boxes)

fields.label: How are the access restrictions enforced?
fields.shortName: Details of enforcement of access restrictions

sections.title: 6.4.2: Cargo units (as containers, swap bodies, transport boxes)

fields.label: Briefly describe what measures are in place to prevent unauthorised access to and tampering with cargo units (particularly in open storage areas, for example, constant supervision, training staff and making them aware of risks, seals, instructions on procedures to follow in the case of unauthorised entry)
fields.shortName: Measures to prevent unauthorised access to cargo units

sections.title: 6.4.3: Cargo units (as containers, swap bodies, transport boxes)

fields.label: Do you use seals to prevent unauthorised tampering with goods?
fields.shortName: Seals used to prevent unauthorised tampering

sections.title: Cargo units (as containers, swap bodies, transport boxes)

fields.label: What kind of seals do you use to prevent tampering?
fields.shortName: Seals used to prevent unauthorised access to cargo units

fields.label: Do these seals satisfy any specific standards (for example, ISO)?
fields.shortName: Seals specific standards

sections.title: Cargo units (as containers, swap bodies, transport boxes)

fields.label: How do you make sure that goods are not tampered with if seals are not used?
fields.shortName: How I ensure goods are not tampered with

fields.label: What control measures do you use for checking cargo units (for example, 7-point inspection process: front wall, left side, right side, floor, covering/roof, inside/outside of doors, outside/undercarriage)?
fields.shortName: Control measures for checking cargo units

fields.label: Who is the owner/operator of the cargo units?
fields.shortName: Owner/operator of the cargo units

fields.label: Who maintains/repairs the cargo units?
fields.shortName: Cargo units maintenance

fields.label: Are there regular maintenance plans?
fields.shortName: Regular maintenance plans in place

fields.label: Are external maintenance works checked?
fields.shortName: External maintenance works checked

sections.title: 6.5.1: Logistical processes
sections.description: Guidance for this section can be found at (AEO Guidelines Part 2 Section V, Subsection 4)

fields.label: Which means of transport are normally used by your company?
fields.shortName: Means of transport used

fields.label: Does your company carry out all its own transport, or does it also use external service providers (for example, freight forwarders/carriers)?
fields.shortName: Own or external transport

fields.label: How do you establish whether the freight forwarder/carrier meets the required security standards (for example, by means of a security certificate, declarations or agreements)?
fields.shortName: Establish meets required standards

fields.label: Do you take other measures for outsourced transport activities with a view to meeting security standards?
fields.shortName: Other measures for outsourced transport activities undertaken

fields.label: Outline the nature and scope of your measures in this respect
fields.shortName: Nature and scope of your measures

sections.title: 6.6.1: Logistical processes
sections.description: Guidance for this section can be found at (AEO Guidelines Part 2 Section V, Subsection 4)

fields.label: Briefly describe the procedure for ensuring the security and safety of incoming goods
fields.shortName: Procedures for ensuring safety of incoming goods

fields.label: Briefly describe how the compliance with these procedures is checked
fields.shortName: How compliance with procedures is checked

fields.label: Are your employees informed about security arrangements with suppliers?
fields.shortName: Employees informed about suppliers security arrangements

fields.label: How is compliance ensured?
fields.shortName: Procedures for ensuring compliance

fields.label: Are incoming goods sealed, if appropriate?
fields.shortName: Employees informed about suppliers security arrangements

fields.label: Briefly describe how checks on the integrity of the seals on incoming goods are conducted
fields.shortName: Incoming seals integrity checks

sections.title: Logistical processes - Specific goods and specific security measures
sections.shortName: Specific goods and specific security measures

fields.label: Does your company deal with specific types of goods requiring specific security measures (eg air cargo/air mail)?
fields.shortName: Specific types of goods requiring specific security measures

fields.label: What routines/measures are in place for dealing with specific types of goods with specific security measures?
fields.shortName: Specific goods routines/measures

fields.label: Are the incoming goods marked?
fields.shortName: Incoming goods marked

fields.shortName: Goods markings

fields.label: 6.6.5: Briefly describe the process for counting and weighing incoming goods
fields.shortName: 6.6.5: Process for counting and weighing incoming goods

fields.label: 6.6.6: Briefly describe how and when incoming goods are checked against the accompanying documents and entered in your records

fields.shortName: Incoming goods checked by whom and what they are checked against

fields.label: Are the sections responsible for the purchase of goods, the receipt of goods and general administration clearly separated?
fields.shortName: Sections reesponsible clearly seperated

fields.label: Do integrated internal control mechanisms exist between the sections?
fields.shortName: Integrated internal control systems exist

fields.label: How are the integrated internal control mechanisms executed?
fields.shortName: How integrated internal control mechanisms are executed

sections.title: 6.7.1: Storage of goods
sections.description: Guidance for this section can be found at (AEO Guidelines Part 2 Section V, Subsection 4)

fields.label: Describe at which locations you have set aside areas for the storage of goods
fields.shortName: Locations with set aside areas for the storage of goods

fields.label: Briefly describe the routine for allocating a storage position for incoming goods
fields.shortName: Routine for allocating a storage position for incoming goods

fields.label: Do you have outdoor storage locations?
fields.shortName: Outdoor storage locations

fields.label: Briefly describe the outdoor storage locations
fields.shortName: Outdoor storage locations details

fields.label: Do you have documented stocktaking and procedures for dealing with irregularities?
fields.shortName: Documented stocktaking and procedures for dealing with irregularities

fields.label: Briefly describe your arrangements for stocktaking and procedures for dealing with irregularities
fields.shortName: Arrangements for stocktaking

sections.title: 6.7.4: Storage of goods - different risk levels

fields.label: Are goods of different risk levels stored separately?
fields.shortName: Different risk levels stored seperately

fields.label: Describe the criteria for any separate storage, for example, hazardous goods, high-value goods, chemicals, weapons, air cargo/air mail
fields.shortName: Criteria for seperate storage

fields.label: Describe how you make sure that the goods are immediately recorded in the logistical accounts/stock records
fields.shortName: How goods are immediately recorded

fields.label: Briefly describe how goods are protected against unauthorised access to the warehousing premises

fields.label: Briefly describe how compliance with these procedures is checked

fields.label: As your storage of goods is outsourced to a third party please describe briefly how and where the goods are stored and your control measures you use to supervise the handling of goods.
fields.shortName: 6.7.6: Describe how and where goods are stored and supervisory control measures

sections.title: 6.8.1: Production of goods
sections.description: Guidance for this section can be found at (AEO Guidelines Part 2 Section V, Subsection 4)

fields.label: Briefly describe what locations/areas are designated for the production of goods

fields.shortName: How the integrity of the goods is ensured

fields.label: Are there any security measures protecting goods against unauthorised access to the production zone?
fields.shortName: Security measures against unauthorised access to production zone

fields.label: Briefly describe how compliance with these security measures protecting goods against unauthorised access to the production zone are checked
fields.shortName: How compliance with these procedures is checked

fields.label: Briefly describe the procedures for packing products

fields.label: Do the procedures for packing products exist in written form?
fields.shortName: Procedures for packing products exist in written form

fields.label: If final packaging is outsorced to a third party, briefly describe how the integrity of the goods is guaranteed. If not outsourced enter N/A
fields.shortName: 6.8.4: Procedures for packing products

sections.title: 6.9.1: Loading of goods
sections.description: Guidance for this section can be found at (AEO Guidelines Part 2 Section V, Subsection 4)

fields.label: Briefly describe how loading of goods is managed in your company (for example, allocation of responsibilities, checks on goods, and means of transport, recording of results, provision of information, and so on)?
fields.shortName: How goods loading is managed

fields.label: Are there any written instructions on how the process should be organised?
fields.shortName: Written instructions on how the process should be organised

fields.label: Are outgoing goods or vehicles sealed?
fields.shortName: Outgoing goods or vehicles sealed

fields.label: How are outgoing goods or vehicles sealed, by whom and what sort of seals do you use?
fields.shortName: Seals used

fields.label: Are any seal numbers mentioned in the documents accompanying the goods?
fields.shortName: Outgoing goods or vehicles sealed

fields.label: How do you keep a record of your seals?
fields.shortName: How you keep a record of your seals

fields.label: Briefly describe how compliance with customers' security requirements for loading is guaranteed
fields.shortName: 6.9.3: How compliance with customers' security requirements for loading is guaranteed

fields.label: Briefly describe the arrangements that are in place which ensures that goods to be loaded and the loading process are not left unsupervised
fields.shortName: 6.9.4: Arrangements in place which ensures that goods to be loaded and the loading process are not left unsupervised

fields.label: Are the outgoing goods checked for completeness (for example, counted, weighed)?
fields.shortName: 6.9.5: Outgoing goods checked

fields.label: How and by whom are the outgoing goods checked for completeness?
fields.shortName: How and by whom outgoing goods are checked

fields.label: Briefly describe how, when and by whom departing goods are checked against orders and loading lists and recorded out of the stock records
fields.shortName: 6.9.6: How departing goods are checked

fields.label: Briefly describe what control mechanisms you have in place for detecting irregularities concerning the loading of goods
fields.shortName: 6.9.7: Control mechanisms in place for detecting irregularities

sections.title: Have you completed all the forms for your application?

fields.infoText:
You need to send all relevant forms within a 24 hour period, or your application will be rejected.

If you are not ready to send all your forms within this period, you need to save and come back later.

fields.label: What do I need to complete?
fields.infoText:
If you are applying for AEO status customs simplification (AEOC) you need to complete the following forms:

C117

C118-1-1

C118-1-2

C118-1-3

C118-2

C118-3-1

C118-3-2

C118-4

C118-5


If you are applying for AEO status security and safety (AEOS) you need to complete the following forms:

C117

C118-1-1

C118-1-2

C118-1-3

C118-2

C118-3-1

C118-3-2

C118-4

C118-6-1

C118-6-2

C118-6-3

C118-6-4


If you are applying for both you need to complete the following forms:

C117

C118-1-1

C118-1-2

C118-1-3

C118-2

C118-3-1

C118-3-2

C118-4

C118-5

C118-6-1

C118-6-2

C118-6-3

C118-6-4

fields.label: Provide details below of who is signing the declaration
Full name
Job title
fields.helpText: For example, director, financial controller or secretary

fields.label: Email address
fields.helpText: We will send an email to this address to confirm we’ve received this form

fields.infoText: By sending this form, you declare that the information you have provided is true and complete.
This is your last opportunity to print or save a PDF copy of your submitted form.

You need to send us all of the relevant forms within **24 hours**.

If you do not send us these details in time, you will need to start a new application.

If you have sent us all the relevant details, we will tell you within 60 calendar days if your application has been successful.

If your application is unsuccessful we will tell you why.

**If you need help**

[Check the guidance](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/authorised-economic-operator-certification) to find out: 
- what you need to do while we process your application
- how to make changes to your application
- how to contact HMRC about your application
